intro: Indigofera meghalayensis, commonly known as the Shillong indigo plant, is a flowering plant species native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers, which are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
